descriptions.description: Developer turnover reduces the core developer stock as experienced members leave the project.
The skill-up flow increases the new contributors stock by transitioning them from the onboarding pool.
The skill-up flow increases experienced contributors by promoting new contributors who gain proficiency.
The promotion rate flow increases experienced contributors by transitioning them to higher responsibility roles.
The promotion rate flow increases core developers by promoting qualified experienced contributors.
Implicit knowledge transfer accelerates skill development through direct mentorship and collaboration.
Better implicit knowledge transfer increases promotion rates by preparing contributors for advanced roles.
More core developers increase mentorship capacity and implicit knowledge transfer opportunities.
Explicit knowledge transfer accelerates skill development by providing accessible learning resources.
A larger pool of potential contributors increases the new contributors stock through recruitment.
More new contributors increases the skill-up flow as more individuals enter the learning pipeline.
More core developers can increase turnover due to burnout or career progression.
More experienced contributors increases the promotion rate flow by expanding the candidate pool for core roles.
